children.value: These are special arrows — minor magical or mechanical items that give bow-wielding characters a tactical edge. They are written with Knave in mind, but should work for the OSR game of your choice.

Special arrows do the same damage as the bow they are fired from, plus any additional effects. Each arrow is good for one successful hit (unless it seems obvious that it should be otherwise). Missed special arrow shots can usually be recovered, except in the case of arrows like the Bomb Arrow, which explodes.
Three special arrows can fit in an inventory slot.
Tying arrows together to get multiple effects
: totally works and is encouraged. Only roll for weapon damage once, but apply all additional damage/effects from the bundled arrows.

properties.style: position: relative; display: block;  max-width: 432px; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;

padding-bottom: 58.10185185185185%; position: relative; bottom: 0; left: 0; background-image: url('data:image/jpeg;base64,'); background-size: cover; display: block;

properties.alt: Now I'm sad my list doesn't have this.

children.value: Arrows 1-10 are fairly common, and can sometimes be found in stores. Arrows 11+ are rare, and can only be found by adventuring. Some are useless, some are very powerful.
Lights things on fire. 1d6 additional fire damage per round until an action is taken to put it out.
Does 1d6 ice damage. Target must save or become frozen for 1d10 rounds. While frozen they have disadvantage on all saves that require quick movement.
Fills a 20' cube with thick smoke that almost completely blocks sight
Spins out up to 50' of rope behind itself. The rope lasts for 10 minutes before crumbing into dust.
Produces a blindingly bright light and a trail of red smoke.
If you hit with this arrow, all further attacks against the same target have advantage until the arrow is removed.
On hit, bursts into a 5' radius sphere of water.
Covers the hit location in a 10' radius of soft green moss.
Does an additional 1d6 electric damage, target must save or be stunned for 1d6 rounds.
Covers a 5' radius in slippery, flammable oil.
Does an additional 2d6 damage to all within 10' of the target. Save for half.
Spins out a thin, strong span of web behind it. On impact, covers a 10' area in thick, sticky webs.
Does an additional 1d12 poison damage. Save to negate.
Advantage on to-hit rolls, always does maximum damage.
When fired, sings folk songs in a high, clear voice.
On a miss, roll attack vs nearest other creature. Repeat until a hit.
Does half damage. On a hit, roll attack against nearest other creature. Repeat until miss.
Shimmering and trancelucent. Once fired, disappears completely.
Does no damage. If hit, target makes new reaction roll with +1 bonus.
Looks like a regular arrow, explodes for 2d6 damage (save for half) when drawn back in bow.
Flies at a walking pace. Still has the same amount of momentum behind it, just moves in slow motion.
Cannot be moved from where it lands.
Target emits an incredibly delicious odor.
On a hit, target makes morale test with -1 modifier.
Sticks to metals, advantage on to-hit rolls vs creatures wearing metal armour.
Glows golden in the dark. On hit, gives advantage to Save vs fear when you can see the target.
Arrowhead becomes as heavy as a cart when it lands, holding whatever it hits in place.
Archer is teleported to the location where this lands.
With paired scrying glass, archer can see through the arrowhead
Snuffs out all sources of light within 30' for 10 mins.
Always hits its target, if the target is a fish.
Target must save or fall into a deep sleep for 1d6 x 10 mins. Anything less vigorous than a slap will not wake them.
A spell can be cast on this arrow. The spell will be released on hit, with the same target as the arrow.
+1 damage. Roll attack as if it were a melee weapon (using Str bonus).
All creatures within 10’ of target must save or be stunned for a round
Covers the target and surrounding surface in sticky slime
Can be thrown with the range of a longbow. If fired from a bow, triple the firing range.
Comes in pairs of red and blue. When it hits a solid surface, creates a portal at the location of hit, which leads to the matching portal.
Turns target into (d6: 1 dog; 2 sheep; 3 chicken; 4 fish; 5 tree; 6 ogre) for 1d4 x 10 mins
When it hits, rapidly grows into a large oak tree
On hit, target must save or the flesh around the hit location rots for 2d6 additional damage
Causes incredibly distracting itching sensations. Target must save each round for 1d6 rounds or be too distracted to do anything but scratch.
The target is pushed back 1d6 x 10', and must save or be knocked down.
An arrow made of pure gold. Worth 10gp.
Can be called back to the the archer by whistling. 1-in-6 chance of breaking on hit or miss.
When notched in a bow, the bow floats in the air and will stay drawn until a trigger word is spoken.
Target must save or attack the nearest target for 1d4 rounds.
When fired the archer whisperers a wish for the target of the shot. On a hit, it becomes true for 1d6 rounds, after which reality rapidly snaps back into order.
When fired, randomly select the target of this arrow from all creatures with range. Always hits the target.
On hit, the arrow transforms into a confused but vicious wolf.
If the target of this arrow dies within the next day, all sentient creatures in the surrounding area will know it’s fate & location.
Can attack targets around corners or behind cover.
If the target of this arrow dies with the arrowhead stuck in them, their soul is trapped inside it.
Always hits its target, if the target is a natural wild animal.
On hit, target must save or become possessed by a random demon.
When fired, a wild, violent storm forms in the sky. The arrowhead acts as a lighting rod.
Does no damage. Heals weapon damage + 1d6 HP.
Target must save or suffer a grievous wound (bypassing HP).
Target blinks out of reality for 1d6 rounds.
Bright, fragrant flowers rapidly grow in a 10’ radius around the target.
Target must save or be turned to stone.
If shot into a door, it is magically forced open.
When fired, turns into a liquid which can slide under objects & doors until it hits the target.
Target must save or take a random mutation.
Clinging vines burst from the arrowhead, wrapping tightly around the target.
Transforms into a boulder when fired. Target and all within 5’ must make Dex save or take 2d6 damage.
Leaves a bright rainbow trail behind it. On hit, 1d6 gp burst from the arrowhead, dealing 1 additional damage per gp.
Target must save or suffer a random curse.
Archer swaps bodies with the target for 1d6 rounds.
Target must save or a random limb withers into uselessness.
Target must save or follow a single word command spoken by the archer.
On hit, flip a coin. On heads, does double damage. On tails, does no damage.
On hit, this arrow gains the effects of (d6: 1 Fire arrow, 2 Ice arrow, 3 Water arrow, 4 Electric arrow, 5 Oaken arrow, 6 Boulder arrow).
Target must save or fall madly in love with the archer (this does not necessarily mean they are friendly).
Destroys any shield the target is weilding.
Target becomes incredibly drunk, save for mildly intoxicated.
Always hits, as long as the archer is doing a ridiculously showy and dangerous stunt.
Imbued with the soul of a dead wizard. Can talk. Doesn't want to be fired and risk breaking.
Always hits and does max damage, but only if it is the archer's last arrow.
All damage dealt by this arrow is also dealt the the target's closest family member.
Instantly loads a copy of itself into the bow after firing (once). Allows two attacks in a turn.
Emits a deafening boom on hit. Creatures within 60' are deafened for 10 mins.
On hit, splatters the nearby surfaces with multicoloured paint in pleasing manner.
Target must save or succumb to a random disease.
On hit, splashes 5' radius with highly corrosive acid which does 1d4 damage per round. Stops burning after 1d10 rounds.
On hit, explodes into a swarm of angry bees. The bees do 1d6 damage to all creatures within 10', until a 6 is rolled.
Instead of rolling to hit, use 10 as the attack roll result. Instead of rolling for damage, use half the bow's max damage.
If this arrow kills the target, it rises from the dead and will follow the archer's orders. The effect lasts 1d6 hours.
If shot misses, returns to the archer's bow, ready to fire again next round.
Grants advantage on to-hit and damage rolls when shot from horseback.
When fired, splits into two arrows. Roll attacks and select targets separately.
While this arrow is stuck in the target, the archer can hear the target's thoughts.
Arrowhead is a large diamond. Worth 50gp.
When fired, the archer transforms into an eagle for 1d6 rounds. The arrow continues it's flight from wherever the eagle is when the effects ends.
On hit, all sound within a 30' radius is completely silent for 10 mins.
On hit, all undead creatures within 30' radius must save or flee.
Target grows to double it's size for 10 mins.
Target shrinking to half it's size for 10 mins.
When fired, roll on this table again for the effect.

markdownRemark.excerpt: These are special arrows — minor magical or mechanical items that give bow-wielding characters a tactical edge. They are written with Knave…
